meanings.definition: Move from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I go to school every day.
meanings.sent2: The car will go fast on the highway.
meanings.sent3: Let's go to the park and have fun!
meanings.sent4: Her words made me go weak in the knees.
meanings.sent5: The rocket will go up into the sky.

meanings.definition: Proceed or happen in a specified manner.
meanings.sent2: The plan is to go according to schedule.
meanings.sent3: The party will go on until late at night.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to go in circles.
meanings.sent5: The story will go as planned.

meanings.definition: Pass into a specified state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The milk will go bad if left out.
meanings.sent2: The leaves go yellow in the fall.
meanings.sent3: His face will go red when embarrassed.
meanings.sent4: The mood in the room seemed to go sour.
meanings.sent5: The weather will go cold in winter.

meanings.definition: Be in the process of moving.
meanings.sent1: The train is starting to go now.
meanings.sent2: The river water will go downstream.
meanings.sent3: The cat will go chasing after the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The clouds go drifting across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The ball will go bouncing down the stairs.
